job_description:
• At least 12 years of professional software engineering experience delivering production systems at scale.
• Experience working with Apex, Experience Cloud, Service Cloud, and JavaScript.
• Strong understanding of microservices architecture and experience building scalable, maintainable systems.
• Additionally, candidates must have solid experience with the Salesforce platform, including Lightning Web Components (LWC), Apex, and building performant REST APIs.
• A related technical degree required.

• Slack Platform Knowledge: Experience building Slack apps, working with Slack APIs, or understanding Slack's real-time messaging architecture.
• GenAI Integration: Hands-on experience working with generative AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.
• Real-Time Systems: Experience building real-time messaging, notification, or event-driven systems.
• Integration Experience: A background working with complex product integrations or connecting disparate systems.
• Microservices Architecture: Experience designing and operating microservices architectures using containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
• Observability: Strong background in monitoring, logging, and alerting (e.

• In this role, you will play a key part in defining software requirements, designing embedded solutions, and verifying system performance, ensuring our maintenance systems meet the evolving needs of modern aircraft.
• The ideal candidate will bring hands‑on experience with system‑level testing, REST APIs, structured data formats, and embedded or IoT platforms to ensure the reliability, performance, and compliance of technologies deployed across mission‑critical environments worldwide.
• You’ll bridge engineering and IT to ensure complex aerospace development ecosystems perform at scale, meet rigorous standards, and align with regulatory and export‑controlled requirements.
• This position is ideal for engineers experienced in modern software development methodologies, debugging, and performance optimization, who thrive in highly technical, cross‑functional environments.
